description: {"blocks":[{"key":"1318n","text":"Background","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5pa7m","text":"Advances in our technological capacity to interrogate brain tumour biology has led to the ever-increasing use of genomic sequencing in routine diagnostic decision making. Presently, brain tumours are routinely classified based on their epigenetic signatures, leading to a paradigm shift in diagnostic pathways. Such testing can be performed so rapidly using nanopore sequencing that results can be provided intraoperatively. This information greatly improves upon the fidelity of smear diagnosis and can help surgeons tailor their approach, balancing the risks of surgery with the likely benefit. Nevertheless, full integrated diagnosis may require subsequent additional assays to detect pathognomonic somatic mutations and structural variants, thereby delaying the time to final diagnosis. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dru3g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"avuhk","text":"Methods","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"av5bu","text":"Here, we present ROBIN, a tool based upon PromethION nanopore sequencing technology that can provide both real-time, intraoperative methylome classification and next-day comprehensive molecular profiling within a single assay. ROBIN uniquely integrates three methylation classifiers 1–3 to improve diagnostic performance in the intraoperative setting. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c8fmt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"157ak","text":"Findings","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3nmda","text":"We demonstrate classifier performance on 50 prospective intraoperative cases, achieving a diagnostic turnaround time under 2 hours and generating robust tumour classifications within minutes of sequencing. Furthermore, ROBIN can detect single nucleotide variants (SNVs), copy number variants (CNVs) and structural variants (SVs) in real-time, and is able to inform a complete integrated diagnosis within 24 hours. Classifier performance demonstrated concordance with final integrated diagnosis in 90% of prospective cases. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5j3j3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6tk8v","text":"Interpretation","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fq42n","text":"Nanopore sequencing can greatly improve upon the turnaround times for standard of care diagnostic testing, including sequencing, and is furthermore able to reliably provide clinically actionable intraoperative tumour classification. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"http://protocols.io"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"http://protocols.io"}}}}

materials_text:
{"blocks":[{"key":"bfubd","text":"1. Qiagen QIAamp Fast DNA Tissue Kit (#51404)
2. Ultra-Long DNA Sequencing Kit V14 (SQK-ULK114)
3. AMPure XP SPRI Reagent (A63880)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ib7u","text":"4. PEGW buffer (10% PEG-8000/0.5M NaCl; filtered only)
5. 10 mM Tris-HCl pH 9.0
6. Qubit 1X dsDNA High Sensitivity (HS) Assay kit (Q33230 or Q33231)
7. Genomic DNA ScreenTape Analysis (5067-5365 and 5067-5366)
8. 1.5 ml Eppendorf DNA LoBind tubes (#0030108051)
9. 0.2 ml PCR tubes
10. PromethION flow cells R10.4.1
11. Flow cell wash kit (EXP-WSH004 - additional)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3e2m2","text":"Open tissue pot in Category 3 MSC and weigh total mass on petri dish.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"49pqi","text":"Prepare a smear slide, using tissue adjacent to samples 1 to 3 arranged in a Left-to-Right orientation, labelled α, β, γ.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c0vum","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fld6f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d2167","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"50v44","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4i9kb","text":"Tissue labelled α, β, γ on slide to avoid confusion with routine laboratory nomenclature and sample labelling.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"88DCE79DDA094F548393773D8533D45F"}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2ibjd","text":"During following DNA extraction steps, Neuropathologist to report smear and advise on most suitable sample to take forward for library preparation.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"771317870DE74422B1B4E909C32C086C"}}}}
